description: Dribbling is the art of moving the ball past your opponent without allowing him to tackle you, allowing you to keep possession
Shooting is hitting the ball in an attempt to score a goal. It is usually done using the feet or head.A shot on target or shot on goal is a shot that enters the goal or would have entered the goal
The primary purposes of tackling are to dispossess an opponent of the ball, to stop the player from gaining ground towards goal or to stop them from carrying out what they intend.
A header is a technique that is used in association football to control the ball using the head to pass, shoot or clear.
Passing brings an advantage in that the team secures possession of the ball, without allowing the opposition an opportunity to attack.
The intention of a cross is to directly bring the ball into the box from an angle that allows the attacking forwards to more easily aim for goal with their head or feet.
